588889 THE INDIAN MAJORITY ACT, 1875 1
Act No. 9 OF 1875 1 [ 2nd March, 1875.]
An Act to amend the law respecting the age of majority.
Preamble.
WHEREAS, in the case of persons domiciled in 2 India] it is expedient 3 to specify the age of Majority];
It is hereby enacted as follows:-
1551156 1Short title. Local extent, commencement and operation.- This Act may be called the 4 Majority Act, 1875. 5 It extends to the whole of India 6 except the State of Jammu and Kashmir]];
and it shall come into force and have effect only on the expiration of three months from the passing thereof.
320388 2 Saving.- Nothing herein contained shall affect:--
143788 athe capacity of any persons to act in the following matters (namely),-- marriage, dower, divorce and adoption;
741617 bthe religion or religious rites and usages of any class of 7 citizens of India]; or
1869427 cthe capacity of any person who before this Act comes into force has attained majority under the law applicable to him.
1124939 3 8 Age of majority of persons domiciled in India.-
304971 1Every person domiciled in India shall attain the age of majority on his completing the age of eighteen years and not before.
441947 2In computing the age of any person, the day on which he was born is to be included as a whole day and he shall be deemed to have attained majority at the beginning of the eighteenth anniversary of that day.]
